DOC.brief_summary: The risk of delayed cerebral ischemia (DCI) after subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) is associated with large cerebral artery vasospasm, but vasospasm is not a strong predictor for DCI. Assessment of cerebral autoregulation with transcranial Doppler (TCD) may improve the prediction of DCI. The aim of this prospective study was to assess the value of TCD-derived variables to be used alone or in combination for prediction of DCI
DOC.brief_title: Determinants of Vasospasm and Delayed Ischemic Deficits in Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
